description: From earlier chawe (“jaw”). More at jaw. See also chew.

examples: When the doctor told him to quit smoking, Harvey switched to chaw, but then developed cancer of the mouth.

entries.meaning: (countable) A plug or wad of chewing tobacco.

examples: all the poison ran about his chaw

verbs.description: chaw (third-person singular simple present chaws, present participle chawing, simple past and past participle chawed)

entries.meaning: (archaic or nonstandard outside dialects, e.g. Appalachia, Southern US) To chew; to grind with one's teeth; to masticate (food, or the cud)
examples: The trampling steede, with gold and purple trapt,
Chawing the fomie bit, there fercely stood.

entries.meaning: (obsolete, transitive) To ruminate (about) in thought; to ponder; to consider
examples: "I home retourning, fraught with fowle despight,And chawing vengeaunce all the way I went,Soone as my loathed love appeard in sight,With wrathfull hand I slew her innocent;
